shortdesc.ph: Sets beauty effect options for facial areas and specifies the media source.
Sets beauty effect options for face areas and specifies the media source.

p.codeblock: virtual int setFaceShapeAreaOptions(const FaceShapeAreaOptions& options, agora::media::MEDIA_SOURCE_TYPE type = agora::media::PRIMARY_CAMERA_SOURCE) = 0;
public abstract int setFaceShapeAreaOptions(FaceShapeAreaOptions options, Constants.MediaSourceType sourceType);

section.p: If the preset beauty effect via does not meet your expectations, you can use this method to set beauty options for specific facial areas and fine-tune each part to achieve more refined results.

If the preset beauty effects set by the setFaceShapeBeautyOptions method do not meet expectations, you can use this method to set beauty area options and fine-tune each part of the face for more refined beauty effects. This method is similar to , but it supports specifying the media source to which the beauty effect is applied.

ul.li: This method is only supported on Android 4.4 or later.
This method depends on the beauty effect dynamic library . If the library is deleted, the feature cannot be enabled.
This feature requires high device performance. The SDK automatically detects device capabilities when this method is called.
This method is only supported on Android 4.4 or later.
This method depends on the beauty effect dynamic library . If the library is deleted, the feature cannot be enabled.
This feature requires high device performance. The SDK will automatically detect the device capability when this method is called.

section.title: Timing
section.p: Call this method after calling setFaceShapeBeautyOptions.

plentry.pd:
The media source type. See . This parameter only supports the following two settings:
If using the camera to capture local video, use the default value PRIMARY_CAMERA_SOURCE.
If using a custom video source, set this parameter to CUSTOM_VIDEO_SOURCE.

Media source type for applying filter effects. See . In this method, this parameter only supports the following two settings:
If using the camera to capture local video, use the default value PRIMARY_CAMERA_SOURCE.
If using a custom video source, set this parameter to CUSTOM_VIDEO_SOURCE.

ul.li:
< 0: Failure.
-4: The current device does not support this feature. Possible reasons include:
The device does not meet the performance requirements for beauty effects. Agora recommends using a high-performance device.
The device runs Android version lower than 4.4, which is not supported. Agora recommends changing the device or upgrading the OS.

< 0: Failure.
-4: The current device does not support this feature. Possible reasons include:
The device does not meet the requirements for beauty effects. It is recommended to use a high-performance device.
The device version is lower than Android 4.4 and does not support this feature. It is recommended to upgrade the OS or change the device.
